Utility function to fetch while bypassing the cache, and with some default options.


11const cfFetch = (uri, options) => {


12    return fetch(uri, {


13        credentials: 'same-origin',


14        ...options,


15    });


16}


17


This api object provides some utility methods we use to fetch and push stuff to and from the Codeframe internal API.


20const api = {


21    get: path => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


22        method: 'GET',


23    }),


24    post: (path, body) => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


25        method: 'POST',


26        body: body,


27    }),


28    errlog: e => console.error(`Codeframe API error:\n\t${e}`),


29}


30


31const now = () => new Date().getTime();


32


Debounce coalesces multiple calls to the same function in a short period of time into one call, by cancelling subsequent calls within a given timeframe.


36const debounce = (fn, delayMillis) => {


37    let lastRun = 0;


38    let to = null;


39    return (...args) => {


40        clearTimeout(to);


41        const dfn = () => {


42            lastRun = now();


43            fn(...args);


44        }


45        if (now() - lastRun > delayMillis) {


46            dfn()


47        } else {


48            to = setTimeout(dfn, delayMillis);


49        }


50    }


51}

167    selectInput(evt) {


168        evt.preventDefault();


169        evt.target.select();


This is a weird and funky workaround for the fact that, in Safari, the selection made here from a focus event is cancelled immediately by a proceeding mouseup event, when it happens. So we .preventDefault() only the next immediate mouseup event.


173        const cancelMouseup = e => {


174            e.preventDefault();


175            evt.target.removeEventListener('mouseup', cancelMouseup);


176        };


177        evt.target.addEventListener('mouseup', cancelMouseup);


178        gevent('preview', 'selecturl');


179    }


180


181    handleRefresh() {


Force-refreshing the preview works by clearing the "last url" fetched, so it looks like the same URL is a new URL on next render.


184        this._lastURL = '';


185        this.render();


186        gevent('preview', 'refresh');


187    }


188


189    safelySetIframeURL(url) {


If the iframe already has content, we want to replace its uri; if not, we want to give it a uri. This takes care of this logic.


192        if (this._lastURL !== url) {




If we simply assign to iframe.src property here, it adds an entry to the parent page's back/forward history, which we don't want. We only want to add to src if the iframe does not already have a page loaded (i.e. when contentWindow is null).


196            if (this.iframe.contentWindow) {


197                this.iframe.contentWindow.location.replace(url);


198            } else {


199                this.iframe.src = url;


200            }


201            this._lastURL = url;


202        }


203    }


204


205    compose(data) {


If we're not rendering from a saved Codeframe from the server but instead rendering a "live" preview, generate a data URI instead and point the iframe to that. Otherwise, just use the URL to the saved preview.


209        let url = '';


210        if (data.liveRenderMarkup === null) {


211            url = `${window.location.origin}/f/${data.htmlFrameHash}/${data.jsFrameHash}.html`;


212        } else {


213            url = 'data:text/html,' + encodeURIComponent(data.liveRenderMarkup);


214        }


215        this.safelySetIframeURL(url);


216


We compare the new URL to the old URL here, to see whether we need to reset the src attribute on the iframe. If it's unchanged, we leave the iframe alone.


219        return jdom`<div class="previewPanel" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


220            ${data.liveRenderMarkup === null ? (


221                jdom`<div class="topBar">


222                    <div class="fixed button inputContainer">


223                        <input value="${url}" onfocus="${this.selectInput}" />


224                    </div>


225                    <button class="button refreshButton" title="Refresh preview"


226                        onclick="${this.handleRefresh}">↻</button>


227                    <a class="button previewButton" title="Open preview in new tab"


228                        target="_blank" href="${url}">Preview</a>


229                </div>`


230            ) : (


231                jdom`<div class="topBar">


232                    <div class="unsavedWarning">


233                        tap


234                        <div class="fixed inline button">Save ${'&'} Reload</div>


235                        to share <span class="mobile-hidden">→</span>


236                    </div>


237                </div>`


238            )}


239            ${this.iframe}


240        </div>`;


241    }


242


243}


244


Shorthand function that inserts a script tag with a given source and returns a promise that resolves when the script is loaded and evaluated. We use this as a minimal module loader to bootstrap loading of editor modules.


248const loadScript = url => {


249    const tag = document.createElement('script');


250    tag.src = url;


251    tag.async = true;


252    return new Promise((res, _rej) => {


253        tag.addEventListener('load', res);


254        document.body.appendChild(tag);


255    });


256}


257


Editor implementations


259




Codeframe uses multiple different editor backends (EditorCore implementations) to implement the actual code editor part of Codeframe. This is because...  1. It reduces reliance on one particular third-party editor. 2. It creates an interface under which new editor backends can be added / experimented with. 3. Different editor backends are best suited for different clients.  We currently use two backends, Visual Studio Code's Monaco editor, which also runs CodeSandbox; and CodeMirror, which powers Glitch, Chrome DevTools, and more. You can also find a reference implementation of a bare-bones editor built on <textarea> in static/js/editors/textarea.js.


270




Monaco-based implementation of EditorCore


272class MonacoEditor {


273


274    constructor(callback) {


275        this.mode = 'html';


276


Frames are temporary storage of loaded / saved Codeframe source files before the editor itself has been loaded and initialized.


279        this.frames = {


280            html: '',


281            javascript: ``,


282        }


Monaco's core data structure backing each source file in the editor is the "model". Each model represents and holds edit data, history, etc. for one file. We keep track of two and swap between them in one editor instance.


286        this.models = {


287            html: null,


288            javascript: null,


289        }


290


291        this.container = document.createElement('div');


292        this.container.classList.add('editorContainer');


293        this.monacoEditor = null;


294


See setValue() to see why this exists.


296        this._beingSetProgrammatically = false;


297


Load the core editor module loader, and begin bootstrapping the Monaco editor loading process.


300        loadScript('https://unpkg.com/monaco-editor/min/vs/loader.js').then(() => this._loadEditor(callback));


301    }

308            },


309        });


310        require(['vs/editor/editor.main'], () => {


Initialize models for both files

313            this.models.javascript = monaco.editor.createModel(this.frames.javascript, 'javascript');

Define a custom theme

317                base: 'vs',


318                inherit: true,

320                    {token: '', foreground: '000000', background: 'ffffff'},


321                    {token: 'comment', foreground: '888888', fontStyle: 'italic'},


322


Javascript-related highlights

Create one editor instance, in which we can swap between the two source file models being edited.

349                fontFamily: "'Menlo', 'Monaco', monospace",


350            });


351            this.setMode(this.mode);


352


When the editor loads, bring the focus to it unless there is another element with focus.

The following interface methods are shared between all EditorCore implementations


364


365    getValue(mode = this.mode) {


366        if (this.ready()) {


367            return this.models[mode].getValue();


368        } else {


369            return this.frames[mode];


370        }


371    }


372


373    setValue(value, mode = this.mode) {


374        if (this.ready()) {


375            if (this.models[mode].getValue() !== value) {


Monaco doesn't have the ability to distinguish between changes to editor content that happens because of user-initiated edits vs. programmatic edits using setValue(). Since we only want to fire change event handlers for the former kind of change, we keep track of the "is this a programmatic change" state in this variable.


381                this._beingSetProgrammatically = true;


382                this.models[mode].setValue(value);


383                this._beingSetProgrammatically = false;


384            }


385        } else {


386            this.frames[mode] = value;


387        }


388    }


389


390    getMode() {


391        return this.mode;


392    }


393


394    setMode(mode) {


395        this.mode = mode;


396        if (this.ready()) {


397            this.monacoEditor.setModel(this.models[mode]);


398        }


399    }


400


401    addChangeHandler(handler) {


402        if (this.ready()) {


403            const userChangeHandler = () => {


404                if (!this._beingSetProgrammatically) {


405                    handler();


406                }


407            }


In Monaco, there isn't change events in the editor, but instead change events in the models, which we listen for.


410            this.models.html.onDidChangeContent(userChangeHandler);


411            this.models.javascript.onDidChangeContent(userChangeHandler);


412        }


413    }


414


415    getContainer() {


416        return this.container;


417    }


418


419    resize() {


420        if (this.ready()) {


421            this.monacoEditor.layout();


422        }


423    }


424


425    ready() {


426        return this.monacoEditor !== null;


427    }


428


429}

CodeMirror-based implementation of EditorCore, which is enabled on mobile browsers because Monaco is not mobile browser-compatible. This implementation is also slightly faster on slower networks.


434class CodeMirrorEditor {


435

440            html: '',

442        }


The Document is CodeMirror's data structure for storing file and editor contents, edit history, etc. To swap between files / modes, we swap between these two documents.


446        this.documents = {


447            html: null,


448            javascript: null,


449        }

This bootstraps the loading process for the CodeMirror editor.

459    async _loadEditor(callback) {


We fix the version number here because CM 6 is going to have breaking API changes, and it's unclear at time of writing if that'll be released under the same package.


463        const EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT = 'https://unpkg.com/codemirror@5';


464        const EDITOR_SCRIPT_SRC = EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT + '/lib/codemirror.js';


465        const LANG_SCRIPT_SRC = [


466            'javascript',


xml and css are dependencies of htmlmixed, the standalone (not embedded) HTML language mode for CM.


469            'xml',


470            'css',


471            'htmlmixed',


472        ].map(mode => `${EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT}/mode/${mode}/${mode}.js`);


473        const AUX_SRC = [


474            'edit/closetag.js',


475            'edit/closebrackets.js',


476        ].map(path => `${EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT}/addon/${path}`);


477


CodeMirror has an accompanying stylesheet. We load this manually here.

480        styleLink.rel = 'stylesheet';


481        styleLink.href = EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT + '/lib/codemirror.css';


482        document.head.appendChild(styleLink);


483


These must load in this order -- language modes must load after the core editor is loaded, but once the core editor is loaded, everything else can load in parallel.


487        await loadScript(EDITOR_SCRIPT_SRC);


488        await Promise.all([


489            ...LANG_SCRIPT_SRC,


490            ...AUX_SRC,


491        ].map(loadScript));


492


493        this.documents.html = CodeMirror.Doc(this.frames.html, 'htmlmixed');


494        this.documents.javascript = CodeMirror.Doc(this.frames.javascript, 'javascript');


495


496        this.codeMirrorEditor = CodeMirror(this.container, {


497            indentUnit: 4,


498            tabSize: 4,


499            lineWrapping: false,


500            lineNumbers: true,


501            indentWithTabs: true,


502


503            // provided by edit/closetag.js


504            autoCloseTags: true,


505


506            // provided by edit/closebrackets.js


507            autoCloseBrackets: true,


508        });


We swap the document in after instantiation rather than in creation, because the latter option strips the document of its language mode. This seems like a poorly documented behavior of CM.


512        this.setMode(this.mode);


513


514        if (document.activeElement === null || document.activeElement === document.body) {


515            this.codeMirrorEditor.focus();


516        }


517

519    }


520


521    getValue(mode = this.mode) {


522        if (this.ready()) {


523            return this.documents[mode].getValue();


524        } else {


525            return this.frames[mode];


526        }


527    }


528


529    setValue(value, mode = this.mode) {


530        if (this.ready()) {


531            if (this.documents[mode].getValue() !== value) {


532                this.documents[mode].setValue(value);


533            }


534        } else {


535            this.frames[mode] = value;


536        }


537    }


538


539    getMode() {


540        return this.mode;


541    }


542


543    setMode(mode) {


544        this.mode = mode;


545        if (this.ready()) {


546            this.codeMirrorEditor.swapDoc(this.documents[mode]);


547        }


548    }


549


550    addChangeHandler(handler) {


551        if (this.ready()) {


552            this.codeMirrorEditor.on('changes', (_, changeEvent) => {


We want to avoid triggering change events not generated directly from user input. i.e. we don't want to hit change handlers when we reload or reroute.


556                if (changeEvent[0].origin !== 'setValue') {


557                    handler();


558                }


559            });


560        }


561    }


562


563    getContainer() {


564        return this.container;


565    }


566


567    resize() {


568        this.codeMirrorEditor.setSize();


569    }


570


571    ready() {


572        return this.codeMirrorEditor !== null;


573    }


574


575}

Depending on the client, pick the editor implementation that provides the best experience.


578const EditorCore = navigator.userAgent.match(/(Android|iPhone|iPad|iPod)/) ? CodeMirrorEditor : MonacoEditor;

The Editor component encapsulates the editor (currently Monaco or CodeMirror), all file state and undo/redo histories, syntax highlights and other state about the files the user is editing.


583class Editor extends StyledComponent {


584

Percentage of the editor size that the editor pane takes up.

Initial values for extra settings

Is the config bar visible?

Is the as-you-type live reload enabled?

612


Any calls to resizeEditor should be debounced to 250ms. This is negligible to UX in fast modern laptops, but has a noticeable impact on UX for lower-end devices.


615        this.resizeEditor = debounce(this.resizeEditor.bind(this), 250);


616        window.addEventListener('resize', this.resizeEditor);

Live-rendering (previewing unsaved changes) should be debounced, since we don't want to re-render the iframe with every keystroke, for example. But we leave an escape hatch with *Immediate for forced re-renders, etc.

632        this.liveRenderFrames = debounce(this.liveRenderFramesImmediate, 750);


633    }

644


645    fetchFrames(data) {


fetchFrames is in charge of (1) determining based on new data whether we need to re-fetch HTML and JS files for the current version of the Codeframe (or if we have it already) and making those requests and saving the results to the view state. We are careful here to first check if the frames we are looking to fetch aren't the ones already saved in the editor.


650        if (


651            data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash !== this._lastHash


652            && data.htmlFrameHash


653        ) {


654            this._lastHash = data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash;


655            api.get(`/frame/${data.htmlFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


656                return resp.text();


657            }).then(result => {


This checks against a race bug, where more recent "live" edits have been made since we began to fetch frames.


660                if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') === null) {


661                    this.core.setValue(result, 'html');


662                }


663            }).catch(e => api.errlog(e));


664


665            api.get(`/frame/${data.jsFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


666                return resp.text();


667            }).then(result => {


This checks against a race bug. See above.


669                if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') === null) {


670                    this.core.setValue(result, 'javascript');


671                }


672            }).catch(e => api.errlog(e));


673        }


674    }

Initialize the given editor implementation.


677    initEditorCore() {


678        this.core = new EditorCore(core => {


Here we populate potential prefilled values from the URL query strings, and force-live-render it into the preview to make those dirty changes visible without saving these examples to the server.


682            if (loadedURLState.html || loadedURLState.js) {


683                core.setValue(loadedURLState.html, 'html');


684                core.setValue(loadedURLState.js, 'javascript');


685                this.liveRenderFramesImmediate();


686            }


687            core.addChangeHandler(this.liveRenderFrames);

690            this.resizeEditor();


691        });


692    }

696    }

698    switchMode(mode) {


When we switch modes, we have to first save the value of the file being edited, then switch out the underlying file model.


701        this.core.setMode(mode);


702        this.render();


We deep link to the editor tab using the URL hash, so save the new mode state to the hash.

708


liveRenderFrames() is called when the editor content changes, to client-side refresh the iframe preview contents.


711    liveRenderFrames() {


712        if (!this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


713            return;


714        }


715


716        const documentMarkup = `<!DOCTYPE html>


717<html>


718    <head>


719        <meta charset="utf-8"/>


720        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"/>


721        <title>Live Frame | Codeframe</title>


722    </head>


723    <body>


724        ${this.core.getValue('html')}


725        <script src="https://unpkg.com/torus-dom/dist/index.min.js"></script>


726        <script>${this.core.getValue('javascript')}</script>


727    </body>


728</html>`;


729


730        this.record.update({


731            liveRenderMarkup: documentMarkup,


732        });


733    }


734


735    toggleSettings() {


736        this.settings.visible = !this.settings.visible;


737        this.render();


The settings bar changes the editor view size, so we need to re-layout the editor after render.


740        this.resizeEditor();


741    }


742


743    toggleAsYouType() {


744        this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled = !this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled;


745        this.render();


In case there are any current dirty changes when this is toggled on...


747        if (this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


748            this.liveRenderFramesImmediate();


749        }


750        gevent('editor', 'settings.asyoutype', this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled.toString());


751    }


752


saveFrames handles saving / persisting Codeframe files to the backend service, and returns a promise that resolves only once all frame files have been saved.


755    async saveFrames() {


756        const hashes = {


757            html: '',


758            js: '',


759        }


This is a nice way to make the function hang (not resolve its returned Promise) until all of its requests have resolved.


762        await Promise.all([


763            api.post('/frame/', this.core.getValue('html'))


764                .then(resp => resp.text())


765                .then(hash => hashes.html = hash)


766                .catch(e => api.errlog(e)),


767            api.post('/frame/', this.core.getValue('javascript'))


768                .then(resp => resp.text())


769                .then(hash => hashes.js = hash)


770                .catch(e => api.errlog(e)),


771        ]);


Once we've saved the current frames, open the new frames up in the preview pane by going to this route with the new frames.


774        const route = `/h/${hashes.html}/j/${hashes.js}/edit`;


775        if (window.location.pathname.startsWith(route)) {


776            this.record.update({


777                liveRenderMarkup: null,


778            });


779        } else {


780            router.go(route);


781        }


782        gevent('editor', 'save');


783    }


784


785    styles() {


786        return css`


787        height: 100%;


788        flex-grow: 1;


789        flex-shrink: 1;


790        overflow: hidden;


791        border-left: 2px solid var(--cf-black);


792        display: flex;


793        flex-direction: column;


794        @media (max-width: 750px) {


795            /* Overriding inline style */


796            width: 100% !important;


797            height: 50%;


798            border-left: 0;


799            border-top: 2px solid var(--cf-black);


800        }


801        .topBar {

803            flex-direction: row;

805            align-items: center;

808            flex-shrink: 0;

810            overflow-x: auto;


811            .embedded & {


812                background: var(--cf-background);


813            }


814        }

817            flex-direction: row;

819        }

822        }

824            border: 0;


825            background: transparent;


826            height: unset;


827            width: unset;


828            &::before,


829            &::after {


830                display: none;


831            }


832        }


833        .editorContainer,


834        .ready {


835            width: 100%;


836            /* dummy size, flex will resize


837             * but CodeMirror needs a set size.


838             * set to 0 to avoid flex oversize


839             * issues on Android Chrome on focus */


840            height: 0;


841            flex-shrink: 1;


842            flex-grow: 1;


843        }

846            flex-direction: row;

860                background: #fff;


861                border-right: 0;


862            }

865            }


866            &-cursor {


867                border-width: 2px;


868            }


869            &-linenumber {


870                padding-right: 12px;


871            }

874                color: #888;


875            }


876            span.cm-keyword {


877                color: #3436bb;


878                font-weight: bold;


879            }

881                color: #038c6e;

886            }

903            -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch;


904            padding-bottom: 60vh;


905            &:focus {


906                outline: none;


907            }


908        }


909        `;


910    }

912    compose() {


913        const mode = this.core.getMode();


914


915        return jdom`<div class="editor" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


916            <div class="topBar">


917                <div class="buttonGroup">


918                    <button


919                        class="button ${mode === 'html' ? 'active' : ''} tab-html"


920                        title="Switch to HTML editor"


921                        onclick="${this.switchHTMLMode}">


922                        HTML


923                    </button>


924                    <button


925                        class="button ${mode === 'javascript' ? 'active' : ''} tab-js"


926                        title="Switch to JavaScript editor"


927                        onclick="${this.switchJSMode}">


928                        JavaScript


929                    </button>


930                </div>


931                <div class="buttonGroup">


932                    <button class="button ${this.settings.visible ? 'active' : ''}" title="Show additional settings"


933                        onclick="${this.toggleSettings}">...</button>


934                    <button class="button" title="Save Codeframe and reload preview"


935                        onclick="${this.saveFrames}">Save ${'&'} Reload</button>


936                </div>


937            </div>


938            ${this.settings.visible ? (


939                jdom`<div class="topBar">


940                    <button class="button ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? 'active' : ''}"


941                        title="Turn on or off live-reloading as you type"


942                        onclick="${this.toggleAsYouType}">


943                        Reload as you type


944                        ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? '(on)' : '(off)'}


945                    </button>


946                </div>`


947            ) : null}


948            ${this.core.ready() ? this.core.getContainer() : (


If the editor is not yet available (is still loading), show a placeholder bit of text.


951                jdom`<div class="ready"><em>Getting your editor ready...</em></div>`


952            )}


953        </div>`;


954    }


955


956}


957


The Workspace component is the "Codeframe editor". That is to say, this is the component that wraps everything into a neat, interactive page and is the backbone of the Codeframe editing experience.


961class Workspace extends StyledComponent {


962


963    init(frameRecord) {


The left/right panes are split 50/50 between its two panes.


965        this.paneSplit = 50;


966        this.preview = new PreviewPane(frameRecord);


967        this.editor = new Editor(frameRecord);


968


969        this.bind(frameRecord, data => this.render(data));


970


this.grabDragging represents whether there is currently a drag-to-resize-panes interaction happening.


973        this.grabDragging = false;


974        this.handleGrabMousedown = this.handleGrabMousedown.bind(this);


975        this.handleGrabMousemove = this.handleGrabMousemove.bind(this);


976        this.handleGrabMouseup = this.handleGrabMouseup.bind(this);


977


978        window.addEventListener('beforeunload', evt => {


979            if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') !== null) {


980                evt.returnValue = 'You have unsaved changes to your Codeframe. Are you sure you want to leave?';


981            }


982        });


983    }


984


Shortcut method to set the sizes of children components, given one split percentage.


987    setPaneWidth(width) {




These cases implement "snapping" of panes to 0, 50, 100% increments, with 1% buffer around each snap point.


990        if (width < 1) {


991            width = 0;


992        } else if (width > 99) {


993            width = 100;


994        } else if (width > 49 && width < 51) {


995            width = 50;


996        }


997


998        this.paneSplit = width;


999        this.preview.setWidth(width);


1000        this.editor.setWidth(100 - width);


1001        this.render();


1002    }


1003


What follows are mouse/pointer event handlers to make resizing a smooth experience.


1006


1007    handleGrabMousedown() {


1008        this.grabDragging = true;


1009        this.render();


1010    }


1011


1012    handleGrabMousemove(evt) {


1013        if (this.grabDragging) {


1014            if (!evt.defaultPrevented) {


1015                evt.preventDefault();


1016            }


If the event is a touch event, get the clientX of the first touch point, not the whole event.


1019            if (evt.touches) {


1020                evt = evt.touches[0];


1021            }


1022            this.setPaneWidth(evt.clientX / window.innerWidth * 100);


1023        }


1024    }


1025


1026    handleGrabMouseup() {


1027        this.grabDragging = false;


1028        this.render();


1029        gevent('workspace', 'resize', 'editor', this.paneSplit);


1030    }


1031


1032    styles() {


1033        return css`


1034        width: 100%;


1035        height: 100%;


1036        display: flex;


1037        flex-direction: column;


1038        header {


1039            display: flex;


1040            flex-direction: row;


1041            justify-content: space-between;


1042            align-items: center;


1043            flex-shrink: 0;


1044            padding: 4px;


1045            background: var(--cf-background);


1046            border-bottom: 4px solid var(--cf-black);


1047        }


1048        &.embedded header {


1049            display: none;


1050        }


1051        nav {


1052            display: flex;


1053            flex-direction: row;


1054            flex-shrink: 1;


1055            overflow-x: auto;


1056        }


1057        main {


1058            display: flex;


1059            flex-direction: row;


1060            justify-content: space-between;


1061            align-items: flex-start;


1062            flex-grow: 1;


1063            flex-shrink: 1;


1064            overflow: hidden;


1065            position: relative;


1066            height: 100%;


1067            @media (max-width: 750px) {


1068                flex-direction: column;


1069            }


1070        }


1071        .button {


1072            white-space: nowrap;


1073        }


1074        .newButton {


1075            color: var(--cf-accent);


1076        }


1077        .grabHandle {


1078            position: absolute;


1079            top: 50%;


1080            left: 0;


1081            transform: translate(-50%, -50%);


1082            border-radius: 4px;


1083            width: 8px;


1084            height: 56px;


1085            background: #fff;


1086            border: 3px solid var(--cf-black);


1087            cursor: ew-resize;


1088            z-index: 2000;


1089            &:hover {


1090                background: var(--cf-background);


1091            }


1092            &:active {


1093                background: var(--cf-accent);


1094            }


1095        }


1096        .grabHandleShadow {


1097            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, .1);


1098            position: absolute;


1099            top: 0;


1100            left: 0;


1101            right: 0;


1102            bottom: 0;


1103            z-index: 1000;


1104            transition: opacity .3s;


1105            cursor: ew-resize;


1106            &.hidden {


1107                opacity: 0;


1108                pointer-events: none;


1109            }


1110        }


1111        .fullButton {


1112            display: none;


1113        }


1114        &.embedded .fullButton {


1115            display: block;


1116            position: absolute;


1117            top: unset;


1118            left: unset;


1119            bottom: 2px;


1120            right: 6px;


1121            font-size: .75em;


1122            z-index: 100;


1123        }


1124        `;


1125    }


1126


1127    compose() {


1128        return jdom`


1129        <div class="workspace ${window.frameElement === null ? '' : 'embedded'}"


1130            ontouchmove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


1131            ontouchend="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}"


1132            onmousemove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


1133            onmouseup="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}">


1134            <header>


1135                <div class="logo">


1136                    <a class="button" href="/">Codeframe</a>


1137                </div>


1138                <nav>


1139                    <a class="button newButton" href="/new?from=editor">


1140                        + New <span class="mobile-hidden">Codeframe</span>


1141                    </a>


1142                    <a class="button tiny-hidden" href="https://twitter.com/thesephist" target="_blank">


1143                        <span class="mobile-hidden">Made by</span> @thesephist


1144                    </a>


1145                    <a class="button" href="https://github.com/thesephist/codeframe" target="_blank">


1146                        <span class="mobile-hidden">View Source on</span> GitHub


1147                    </a>


1148                </nav>


1149            </header>


1150            <main>


1151                ${this.preview.node}


1152                ${this.editor.node}


1153                <a class="button fullButton"


1154                    title="Open this editor in a new tab"


1155                    target="_blank"


1156                    href="${window.location.href}">


1157                    Open in new tab


1158                </a>


1159                <div class="grabHandleShadow ${this.grabDragging ? '' : 'hidden'}"></div>


1160                <div


1161                    title="Resize editor panes"


1162                    class="grabHandle mobile-hidden"


1163                    style="left:${this.paneSplit}%"


1164                    ontouchstart="${this.handleGrabMousedown}"


1165                    onmousedown="${this.handleGrabMousedown}">


1166                </div>


1167            </main>


1168        </div>`;


1169    }


1170


1171}


1172


The App component simply wraps around the Workspace to provide routing and a container for the workspace.


1175class App extends StyledComponent {


1176


1177    init(router) {


This frameRecord becomes the view model for most views in the editor.


1180        this.frameRecord = new Record({


1181            htmlFrameHash: '',


1182            jsFrameHash: '',


1183            liveRenderMarkup: null,


1184        });


1185        this.workspace = new Workspace(this.frameRecord);


1186


Routing logic.


1188        this.bind(router, ([name, params]) => {


1189            switch (name) {


1190                case 'edit':


1191                    this.frameRecord.update({


1192                        htmlFrameHash: params.htmlFrameHash,


1193                        jsFrameHash: params.jsFrameHash,


1194                        liveRenderMarkup: null,


1195                    });


1196                    break;


1197                case 'welcome':


This is a predetermined URL that points to the welcome Codeframe.


1199                    router.go('/h/34257cad6ac3/j/e3b0c44298fc/edit', {replace: true});


1200                    break;


1201                default:


1202                    {


If there are prefilled HTML and JavaScript values provided in the query string, parse and save it for later when the editor loads.


1206                        const searchPart = window.location.search.substr(1);


1207                        if (searchPart) {


1208                            for (const pair of searchPart.split('&')) {


1209                                const idx = pair.indexOf('=');


1210                                const langPart = pair.substr(0, idx);


1211                                if (langPart in loadedURLState) {


1212                                    loadedURLState[langPart] = decodeURIComponent(pair.substr(idx + 1));


1213                                }


1214                            }


1215                        }


1216                    }


When we redirect some URL right on page load, we want that new URL to replace the old, given URL value, not append a new history entry. So replace the history entry, not append. In this case, we redirect to the URL of an empty Codeframe


1221                    router.go(`/h/e3b0c44298fc/j/e3b0c44298fc/edit`, {replace: true});


1222                    break;


1223            }


1224        })


1225    }


1226


1227    styles() {


1228        return css`


1229        width: 100%;


1230        height: 100vh;


1231        display: flex;


1232        flex-direction: column;


1233        overflow: hidden;


1234        `;


1235    }


1236


1237    compose() {


1238        return jdom`<div id="root">


1239            ${this.workspace.node}


1240        </div>`;


1241    }


1242


1243}


1244


Used to save some global values for when the URL contains a pre-populated code sample or tab state saved in the hash.


1247const loadedURLState = {


1248    html: '',


1249    js: '',


1250    tab: window.location.hash.substr(1),


1251}


1252


1253const router = new Router({


1254    edit: '/h/:htmlFrameHash/j/:jsFrameHash/edit',


1255    welcome: '/welcome',


1256    default: '/new',


1257});


1258


Create a new instance of the editor app and mount it to the DOM.


1260const app = new App(router);


1261document.body.appendChild(app.node);


1262


Since the editor is a full-window app, we don't want any overflows to make the app unnecessary scrollable beyond its viewport.


1265document.body.style.overflow = 'hidden';


1266
